paragraphs.zh-tw: First of all, for those of you who are not familiar with my work, I create multicultural characters, so characters from lots of different backgrounds. So before the present is the new future, a bit about the past is that I grew up in a family that was multi-everything -- multi-racial, multi-cultural, black and white, Caribbean, Irish-American, German-American.
paragraphs.en: 首先，我希望向那些不了解我工作性質的觀眾 解釋一下，我的工作是 創造多元文化人物角色， 亦即是擁有各種各樣文化背景的人物角色。 那麼在談“現在就是新未來”之前， 我要說說過去，我成長所處的家庭 是一個凡事多元的家庭--多元種族、多元文化 黑人、白人、加勒比人 愛爾蘭裔美國人、德國裔美國人，

paragraphs.zh-tw: There was Dominicanmusic blasting from stereos. There were Christians and Jews.
paragraphs.en: 音響爆發的多米尼加音樂震耳欲聾。 家裡既有基督教徒，又有猶太人

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's a long story filled with intrigue and interfaith guilt and shame. But I was totally immersed in this world that was filled with everybody, and then I went on to the United Nations school, and that just completely — So I began sort of developing these voices and these people, all of whom were loosely basedon people I really know, and so, for example, in performing them, I would really try to inhabit them.
paragraphs.en: 我的家事錯綜複雜、信仰各異 充滿了罪過與愧疚，恥辱與遺憾。 但我當時完全沉浸在 充滿了各種角色的世界裡， 然後我就去了聯合國的學校讀書， 而這樣的經歷完全就—— 因此我開始建立這些聲音 建立這些人物角色， 這些人物都來自於我生活中認識的真實人物， 所以比方說，為了扮演他們 我會真正嘗試進入他們的角色。

paragraphs.zh-tw: And for example, I don't really talk like that, but that was one of my people, and I'm going to bring a few of my friends -- I think of them as my friends — to this stage, in this spirit of the idea that the present is the new future, in sort of a meta way, because I thought about it, and the future, for me, what can be so frightening is that I don't know what's coming. I don't know if that's true for other people, but that notion of thinking about how we can understand the future and predict outcomes, for me, it's terrifying to notknow what might be coming.
paragraphs.en: 給大家一個例子， 事實上我一般不會那樣講話， 但那是我其中一個人物的說話方式， 而我即將把幾個朋友—— 我視他們為我的朋友—— 帶到台上 從變化轉換的角度來看 “現在就是新未來” 因為有時我考慮現在和未來 對於我而言，可怕的是 我不知道將來會發生什麼。 我不知道其他人會不會有同樣的想法 但是我的想法是 思考我們如何能夠理解未來、 預測未來， 對於我而言，對未來的無知是相當可怕的。

paragraphs.zh-tw: And so the idea that there are questions that I've never seen that my people are going to answer, and some of these charactershave been with me for ages, some of them don't even have names, I don't know what's going to happen. I don't know what's coming, and all I can do is remind myself that I told Chris I'd fly by the seat of my pants, and now that I'm up here it sort of feels like that dream where you don't have any pants on, and so I suppose I'm going to be flying by the seat of my ass.
paragraphs.en: 一想到會有許多問題 我從來沒見過的問題 但我的人物朋友要回答這些問題， 其中一些人物與我一起很多年了， 其中一些甚至連名字都沒有， 我不知道會發生什麼事情， 我不知道會有什麼問題， 我可以做的就是提醒自己， 我跟克里斯說，我要像武松那樣赤手空拳試試 現在我站在台上 感覺彷彿在夢中變成武大郎， 所以我想我只能是 憑著武大的炊餅試試。

paragraphs.zh-tw: What has changed? Okay, it's like, I have to think about that. "What has changed now that women run the world?" paragraphs.zh-tw: First of all, I just want to say that I appreciate that TED in general has been a pretty orderly crowd, a pretty orderly group. And, you know, I just have to say, the whole thing with baldness, and, you know, here's the thing.
paragraphs.en: 首先我要說 我非常感謝TED組織了這麼一幫有秩序的傢伙 非常有秩序 你知道，我得說 這個禿頭的問題 你知道，這就是問題。

paragraphs.zh-tw: As long as the woman, in my case -- because it's a modern world, do whatever you want to do, I don'thave any problem with anybody, enjoy yourself, LGBTQLMNOP. All right? But as far as I'm concerned, attractiveness, women don't really care as much as you think they do about the, you know. I mean, I remember hearing this woman.
paragraphs.en: 只要是女人，在我看來—— 因為這是一個現代世界 你就可以做你想做的，跟任何人都沒有衝突 享受自我，LGBTQLMNOP（一個同/雙性戀社區），好吧？ 就我所知 比起魅力 女人其實並不像人們想的那樣 那麼在意那個，你懂的。 我是說，我記得有一個女人

paragraphs.zh-tw: She loved her husband, it was the sweetest thing. It's a pretty young girl, you know? And this guy's older.
paragraphs.en: 她很愛她的丈夫，真是羨煞旁人 她又漂亮又年輕，你懂嗎？ 而這男人比她老

paragraphs.zh-tw: And, you know, she said she would love him even if he had snow on the roof or even if melted and disappeared altogether. As far as I'm concerned, it's about the love.
paragraphs.en: 你知道嗎，她說她愛她的男人 就算他頭上頂雪 就算頭頂的雪化了消失了，她也照樣愛。 就我所知，這就是愛。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Am I right, or am I right? So that's it. That's it. That's it. I don't got nothing more to say.
paragraphs.en: 我說對了，還是我說對了？ 所以就是這樣。就是這樣。就是這樣。 我沒有更多要說的

paragraphs.zh-tw: Keep your noses clean. All right, next question.
paragraphs.en: 潔身自愛 好，下一個問題

paragraphs.zh-tw: "Have you ever tasted meat that's not lab grown?" Um, well, I, I want to start by saying that this is a very difficult experience for a Chinese-American. I don't know what to call myself now, because I have really my Chinese identity, but my kids, they are American-Chinese, but it's difficult to try to express myself in front of audience of people like this.
paragraphs.en: 『你曾否嚐過不是實驗室培養出來的肉？』 （中文口音）呃，我 我希望首先說 對於美籍華人來說 這是相當困難的體驗 我現在都不知道怎麼叫自己 因為我是千真萬確的中國人 但是我的小孩，他們就是華裔美國人 但是要試著表達自我，實在是很困難 特別是面前有這麼一群觀眾

paragraphs.zh-tw: But if had to give my opinion about meat, I think first, the most important thing is to say that we don't have to have perfect food, but maybe it can also not be poison. Maybe we can have some middle ground for that.
paragraphs.en: 要是我必須得說說對肉的想法 我想首先，最重要的是 我們不是一定要有完美的食物 但是也許我們吃的食物也可以不是毒藥 也許在這兩者之間可以有第三種選擇

paragraphs.zh-tw: But I will continue to consider this idea, and I will report back maybe next year. Next.
paragraphs.en: 我會繼續考慮這個問題 或許下一年我會回來做報告 下一個

paragraphs.zh-tw: Next. Next. "Will there ever be a post-racial world?" Thank you for having me.
paragraphs.en: 下一個、下一個 『會否有後種族世界？』 （聲音粗啞）謝謝大家邀請我過來

paragraphs.zh-tw: My name is Gary Weaselhead. Enjoy that. I'm a member of the Blackfeet Nation.
paragraphs.en: 我叫咖哩·偉蘇海。好好享受。 我是黒腳族國的一員

paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm also half Lakota, but that is my given name, and no, even though it would have seemed like an obvious choice, no, I did not go into politics. Tough crowd.
paragraphs.en: 我一半血統是拉科塔族，但那就是我的名字 沒有，雖然看上去 會是必然的選擇 但是沒有，我沒有進入政治界 這幫觀眾不易對付

paragraphs.zh-tw: But I always like to just let people know when they ask about race or those kinds of things, you know, as a member ofthe First Nations community, you know, I'm probably not your typical guy. For example, in addition to being an activist, I'm also a professional stand-up comedian.
paragraphs.en: 但是當有人問我關於種族之類的話題 我經常喜歡告訴他們 你懂的，作為第一國家社區的成員 你懂的，也許啊 我不是你們想的典型人物 打個比方，我是一個激進分子，除此之外 我還是一個專業的棟篤笑喜劇演員

paragraphs.zh-tw: And, you know, I'm most popular on college and university campuses. You know, whenever they want to do a diversity day, or hey-we're-not-all-white week, then I'm there.
paragraphs.en: 你懂的，我是頂受歡迎的 特別是在中學和大學校園 你懂的，他們要是哪一天想要搞個“多彩文化日” 或者辦個“我們並不全是白人”週 我就會到那裡

paragraphs.zh-tw: Do I think there will ever be a post-racial world? I think, really, I can't talk about race without remembering that it is a construct in certain respects, but also that, you know, until we redress the wrongs of the past, we're going to be turned around. I don't care if the present is the new future.
paragraphs.en: 你問我未來會不會有一個後種族世界？ 我想，的確，我不能談種族 一談種族我就想起 在某些方面的一些構建 我就想到，你懂的 我們不正視過去的過失 就們就要原地踏步 我才不管你們說什麼現在就是新的未來

paragraphs.zh-tw: I think there's a lot of great people here at TED who are working to address that, so with that, if anything I've said today makes you feel uncomfortable, you're welcome. I think we have time for one more.
paragraphs.en: 我想今天TED來了很多大人物 他們不斷努力正視過去的過失 既然這樣，如果我今天說了什麼 讓你覺得不舒服，不用謝。 我想我們還有時間請多一位。

paragraphs.zh-tw: "What's the most popular diet these days?" Who's here? Okay, well, I'm just gonna answer this really fast, as, like, three or four different people. I mean really fast.
paragraphs.en: 『現在最流行的飲食是什麼？』 誰在？ 好，我會代表三四個人 簡短回答這個問題 非常簡短

paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm just gonna let y'all know that,as far as diet is concerned, if you don't love yourself inside, there is no diet on this Earth that is going to make your behind small enough for you to feel good, so just stop wasting your time. I would just like to say as an African woman that I believe the diet that we need is really to remove the crazy belief that there is anything wrong with a nice backside.
paragraphs.en: 我只想跟大家說，說到飲食 如果你不愛自己 地球上就沒有什麼飲食 可以讓你的小屁股 嬌小得讓你歡心 所以別再浪費時間了 我只想說作為一個非洲女性 我相信我們所需的飲食 就是真正改變一個瘋狂的想法： 一個漂亮的臀部 其實是罪過。

paragraphs.zh-tw: No, I am teasing about that. There is nothing wrong with a woman of size.
paragraphs.en: 這樣的想法很可笑 女人臀部有多大，一點都不是問題

paragraphs.zh-tw: That is what I am trying to say. Women, celebrate your body, for God's sake.
paragraphs.en: 這就是我想說的 女人啊，為你的身材慶賀吧，老天爺。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Stop running around starving. You are making yourselvesand other people miserable.
paragraphs.en: 不要再空着肚子到處跑來 你這不過是在讓你自己和其他人痛苦。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Last answer. So we're talking about what's the most popular diet? I'm gonna start off by telling y'all that this is my first time here at TED.
paragraphs.en: 最後一個回答 （紐約口音）我們在談什麼是最流行的飲食？ 我得先告訴你們 我第一次上來TED

paragraphs.zh-tw: I might not be your typical person you find on this stage. My dental work not as nice as some people.
paragraphs.en: 我不是 你們經常在TED看到的那類人 我的牙醫不像有些人的那麼好

paragraphs.zh-tw: But I made Sarah Jones promise she gonna bring me this time, 'cause she didn't bring me before, but you know, I just want to say, there's a lot of things more important than counting calories, and as somebody living on the streets in New York, and getting to come here,hear y'all ideas worth spreading, I want to tell y'all I believe in this idea that the present is the new future, that where you sit, you create everything that's gonna come, for better or worse. And for me, I think homeless is the wrong word for it anyway.
paragraphs.en: 但是我要薩拉·瓊斯保證 她這一次一定要帶我過來 因為她從來都沒帶我過來 但是你懂的，我只想說 世界上有一大堆的事情 比數卡路里重要 作為一個紐約街頭流浪女人 我來到這裡聽你們說這些值得傳播的想法 我想告訴大家，我相信這個想法 我相信現在就是新的未來 你所到之處，處處生花 創造力源源不斷 對於我來說，我覺得“無家可歸” 不是正確的用詞。

paragraphs.zh-tw: You know, I might not have me no place to lay my head at night, but that just makes me houseless. I have me a home. You do too.
paragraphs.en: 你懂的，也許我就是找不到地方 讓我在晚上躺下我的腦袋 但這不過是無屋可歸 我有自己的家。你們也有自己的家

paragraphs.zh-tw: Find it and try to find yourself in there. Make sure you know, it's not just about virtual reality in space.
paragraphs.en: 找到這個地方，嘗試為自己找到一個家 確保自己知道 這不是單單的空間上的虛擬現實

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's wonderful, but it's also about the actual reality here on Earth. How are people living today? How can you be part of the solution? Thank y'all for thinking about that right now in the present moment to influence the future.
paragraphs.en: 這是很美妙的事情， 這也是地球上的真實現實。 現今人們如何生活？ 你怎樣才能成為解決方案的一分子？ 謝謝大家 現在就在這個時刻 考慮如何影響未來。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I appreciate it. Bye-bye. Thank you all very, very much.
paragraphs.en: 我非常感謝各位。再見。 謝謝大家，非常感謝

paragraphs.zh-tw: Thank you for trusting me, Chris.
paragraphs.en: 謝謝你相信我，克里斯

title: Sarah Jones What Does The Future Hold 11 Characters Offer Quirky Answers
